page.title: 14RATHFRILAND'S LOCAL PAPER
page.content: RATHFRILAND'S LOCAL NEWSPAPER 'THE OUTLOOK' WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1940 AND AT THIS TIME ,ONLY COST ONE OLD PENNY. IT HAD NEVER ANY LOCAL NEWSPAPER TO COMPETE WITH. IN THE PRODUCTION OF A NEWSPAPER, THE WRITTEN COPY IS SET UP AND TYPED. IT IS THEN PROOFED AND READ. NEXT IT IS PASTED ONTO THE PAPER,PHOTOGRAPHED AND PLATED. THESE ARE THEN PLACED IN THE PRINTING MACHINE AND THE REQUIRED NUMBER OF COPIES OF EACH PAGE ARE PRINTED.THE PAGES ARE LOADED ONTO A FOLDING MACHINE AND FOLDED INTO A COMPLETED PAPER. EACH WEEK APPROXIMATELY 10,000 COPIES ARE PRINTED AND CIRCULATED. A LOCAL NEWSPAPER HAS AN ADVANTAGE IN THAT IT DEALS ONLY WITH ITS OWN AREA AND GIVES LOCAL NEWS IN DEPTH.
